p: All four climate change scenarios imply an altitudinal range shift of the El Oro parakeets by the end of the 21 st century. Compared to the altitudinal range of 600â€“1100 m where the species was discovered [ 40], the birds are projected to shift their range uphill at a rate between 40 and 150 m per decade until the year 2100 following a temperature increase. This rate is roughly consistent with the range shifts that have been observed for endemic animal species on mountains in Madagascar and Indonesia [ 14, 15, 17]. Importantly, only under the most optimistic scenario (RCP2.6) will the range shift stagnate after the year 2050 ( Fig 3). However, there are doubts whether climate change mitigation can limit the temperature change to fit the RCP2.6 scenario [ 48, 49]. Therefore, the range shift of the El Oro parakeets will likely exceed the projections under the RCP2.6 scenario and continue at least until the year 2100.
